Pred zaposlenimi na Dnevniku ali znižanje plač ali odpuščanja
07 Nov 2019, 17:18 by STA

V družbi Dnevnik se obeta racionalizacija. Kot je potrdil predsednik sindikata novinarjev Dnevnika Igor Dernovšek, so namreč v sredo na svetu delavcev izvedeli, da jih čaka ali znižanje plač ali odpuščanja. Združevanje Dnevnika z družbo Časnik Večer v novo združeno družbo z imenom DV mediji bi bilo medtem lahko končano že konec februarja.



Foto: Sta

LJUBLJANA > Igor Dernovšek je pojasnil, da je v sredo pred svet delavcev Dnevnika stopil predsednik uprave Dnevnika Bojan Petan, beseda pa je tekla tudi o kolektivni pogodbi. Novembra namreč poteče normativni del njihove kolektivne pogodbe. “Ne ve se, ali bo podaljšana ali ne,” je dejal.
“Ne glede na to, ali bo do združitve prišlo ali ne, bo potrebna bistvena racionalizacija, torej znižanje plač, ker so menda stroški dela visoki. Če se o tem ne bi dogovorili, bi sledila odpuščanja,” je novinar in sindikalist povzel novice s srečanja.
Julija je Petan zagotovil, da bodo kolektivno pogodbo na Dnevniku novembra podaljšali “brez velikih pogajanj”, kot je bilo to že zadnjih deset let. Po združitvi pa je, tako tedaj direktor Večera Uroš Hakl, primerno, da se odprejo pogajanja o kolektivni pogodbi z novo družbo.
Sicer pa novinarji nimajo nobenih novih informacij glede združevanja Dnevnika in Večera. Vedo le, da Petan in Hakl nadaljujeta s postopki združitve. “Pravnoformalno morajo biti postopki zaključeni do konca aprila, naj bi bili pa nekje do konca februarja,” so po Dernovškovih besedah še izvedeli na sestanku.

In front of the Diary employees or pay cuts or layoffs
07 Nov 2019, 17:18 by STA

The company Dnevnik promises rationalization. According to Igor Dernovsek, the president of the Journalists 'Union of Journalists, on Wednesday, the workers' council learned that they were waiting for either wage cuts or redundancies. The merger of Dnevnik with the newspaper Večer into a newly merged company called DV Media could be completed by the end of February.



Photo: Sta

LJUBLJANA> Igor Dernovšek explained that on Wednesday, the President of the Dnevnik Workers Board, Bojan Petan, came before the Dnevnik Workers' Council, and a collective agreement was also discussed. The normative part of their collective agreement expires in November. "It is not known whether it will be extended or not," he said.
“Whether or not the merger will take place will require substantial rationalization, ie a reduction in wages, as labor costs are allegedly high. Failure to agree would result in dismissal, ”the journalist and trade unionist summarized the news from the meeting.
In July, Petan assured that they would extend the collective agreement on Dnevnik in November "without major negotiations", as it has been for the past ten years. After the merger, then the director of Večer Uroš Hakl, it is appropriate to open negotiations on a collective agreement with the new company.
Otherwise, journalists have no new information regarding the merger of Dnevnik and Vecer. All they know is that Petan and Hakl continue the merger process. "Legally, the proceedings must be completed by the end of April, but should be by the end of February," Dernovsk said at the meeting.
